COMMAND.name: show running-configuration pim
COMMAND.help: Displays the current operational pim configurations

COMMAND.name: show ip pim

PARAM.name: vrf
PARAM.help: Display PIM information of the given VRF

PARAM.name: vrf-name
PARAM.help: Display PIM information of the given VRF

PARAM.name: filter
PARAM.help: options: interface, neighbor, rpf, ssm, topology, rp, assert, multicast

PARAM.name: nbr-addr
PARAM.help: IPv4 address of the PIM neighbor

PARAM.name: nbr-detail
PARAM.help: Detailed output for the PIM neighbor

PARAM.name: src-addr
PARAM.help: IPv4 address of the source(0.0.0.0 in case of *,G entry)

PARAM.name: mapping
PARAM.help: show rp mapping for multicast groups

COMMAND.ACTION: sonic_cli_pim show_pim_config vrf:${vrf-name} ssm:${ssm} rpf:${rpf} topology:${topology} rp:${rp} rpGroupAddr:${rp-grp-addr} grpAddr:${grp-addr} srcAddr:${src-addr} nbr:${nbr} nbrAddr:${nbr-addr} ifName:${ifName} interface:${interface} intf-detail:${intf-detail} traffic:${traffic} nbr-detail:${nbr-detail} rpmapping:${mapping} assert:${assert} multicast:${multicast}

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command displays PIM table entries. Available options are: interface, neighbor, ssm, topology and rpf. Results can also be filtered based on VRF name.
DOCGEN.USAGE: * show ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] assert * show ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] interface [<intf-name>] [detail] * show ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] interface [<intf-name>] [traffic] * show ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] neighbor [<nbr-ipv4-address>] [detail] * show ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] ssm * show ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] topology [Group-addr | {Group-addr Source-addr}] * show ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] rpf * show ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] rp [Group-addr] * show ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] rp mapping * show ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] multicast

EXAMPLE.summary: show ip pim [vrf {<vrf-name> | all}] assert

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic# show ip pim assert
PIM assert information for VRF: default Interface Address Source Group State Winner Uptime Timer Ethernet11 11.1.1.1 * 226.1.1.1 NOINFO * 22:08:44 --:-- Ethernet11 11.1.1.1 * 227.1.1.1 NOINFO * 22:08:44 --:--

EXAMPLE.summary: show ip pim [vrf {<vrf-name> | all}] interface [<intf-name>]

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic # show ip pim interface
PIM interface information for VRF: default Interface State Address PIM Nbrs PIM DR Hello-interval PIM DR-Priority Vlan100 up 100.0.0.2 1 100.0.0.2 30 1 Vlan200 up 200.0.0.2 1 200.0.0.3 30 1
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
sonic # show ip pim interface vlan 100
PIM interface information for VRF: default Interface State Address PIM Nbrs PIM DR Hello-interval PIM DR-Priority Vlan100 up 100.0.0.2 1 100.0.0.2 30 1
sonic# show ip pim interface detail | no-more PIM interface detail information for VRF: default Interface : Ethernet12 State : up Address : 11.11.11.12 (primary)
PIM Neighbors ------------- 11.11.11.12 : up for 00:12:26,holdtime expires in 00:01:18
Designated Router ----------------- Address : 11.11.11.12 Local DR Priority : 1 Neighbors that didnot advertise DR Priority : Uptime : 00:12:26 Elections : 1 Changes : 0
Hellos ------ Period : 30 HoldTime : 1 Timer : Receive : 25 Receive Failed : 0 Send : 26 Send Failed : 0 Generation ID : 1072931673
Flags ----- All Multicast : no Broadcast : yes Multicast : yes
Join Prune Interval ------------------- LAN Delay : yes Join Prune Override Interval : 3000 msec
LAN Prune Delay --------------- Propagation Delay : 500 msec Override Interval : 2500 msec
sonic# show ip pim interface traffic Interface HELLO JOIN PRUNE REGISTER REGISTER-STOP ASSERT BSM Rx/Tx Rx/Tx Rx/Tx Rx/Tx Rx/Tx Rx/Tx Rx/Tx -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Ethernet32 3471/14976 42/33 2/3 0/0 0/0 0/0 0/0

EXAMPLE.summary: show ip pim [vrf {<vrf-name> | all}] neighbor [<nbr-ipv4-address>]

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic# show ip pim neighbor
PIM neighbor information for VRF: default Interface Neighbor Uptime Expirytime DR-Priority Vlan100 100.0.0.1 01:38:52 00:01:22 1 Vlan200 200.0.0.3 01:22:33 00:01:13 1
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
sonic# show ip pim neighbor 100.0.0.1
PIM neighbor information for VRF: default Interface Neighbor Uptime Expirytime DR-Priority Vlan100 100.0.0.1 01:38:52 00:01:22 1
sonic# show ip pim neighbor detail PIM neighbor information for VRF: default Interface :Ethernet12 Neighbor :11.11.11.1 Uptime : 00:18:40 Holdtime : 00:01:34 DR Priority : 1 Generation ID : 0x3ff3a359 Override Interval (msec) : 2500 Propogation Delay (msec) : 500 Hello Option - Address List : no Hello Option - DR Priority : True Hello Option - Generation ID : True Hello Option - Holdtime : True Hello Option - LAN Prune Delay : True Hello Option - T-bit : no

EXAMPLE.summary: show ip pim [vrf {<vrf-name> | all}] ssm

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
If IP-prefix list is associated: =============================== sonic# show ip pim ssm
PIM SSM information for VRF: default SSM group range : PIM_PLIST1
-----------------------------------------
If IP-prefix list is not associated: =================================== sonic# show ip pim ssm
PIM SSM information for VRF: default SSM group range : 232.0.0.0/8

EXAMPLE.summary: show ip pim [vrf {<vrf-name> | all}] topology [Group-addr | {Group-addr Source-addr}]

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic# show ip pim topology
PIM multicast routing table for VRF: default (71.0.0.11, 233.0.0.1), uptime 13:08:24, expires 00:00:12 Incoming interface: vlan100, RPF neighbor 100.0.0.1 Outgoing interface list: vlan200 uptime/expiry-time: 13:07:50/00:01:39 vlan122 uptime/expiry-time: 12:33:21/Never
(71.0.0.22, 233.0.0.1), uptime 13:08:45, expires 00:00:18 Incoming interface: vlan100, RPF neighbor 100.0.0.1 Outgoing interface list: vlan200 uptime/expiry-time: 13:22:52/00:01:45 vlan124 uptime/expiry-time: 12:42:28/Never
(101.0.0.22, 225.1.1.1), uptime 13:07:51, expires 00:06:09 Incoming interface: vlan105, RPF neighbor 105.0.0.1 Outgoing interface list: vlan200 uptime/expiry-time: 13:03:50/00:01:39 vlan123 uptime/expiry-time: 13:02:40/Never
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
sonic# show ip pim topology 233.0.0.1
PIM multicast routing table for VRF: default (71.0.0.11, 233.0.0.1), uptime 13:08:24, expires 00:00:12 Incoming interface: vlan100, RPF neighbor 100.0.0.1 Outgoing interface list: vlan200 uptime/expiry-time: 13:07:50/00:01:39 vlan122 uptime/expiry-time: 12:33:21/Never
(71.0.0.22, 233.0.0.1), uptime 13:08:45, expires 00:00:18 Incoming interface: vlan100, RPF neighbor 100.0.0.1 Outgoing interface list: vlan200 uptime/expiry-time: 13:22:52/00:01:45 vlan124 uptime/expiry-time: 12:42:28/Never
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
sonic# show ip pim topology 225.1.1.1 101.0.0.22
PIM multicast routing table for VRF: default (101.0.0.22, 225.1.1.1), uptime 13:07:51, expires 00:06:09 Incoming interface: vlan105, RPF neighbor 105.0.0.1 Outgoing interface list: vlan200 uptime/expiry-time: 13:03:50/00:01:39 vlan123 uptime/expiry-time: 13:02:40/Never

EXAMPLE.summary: show ip pim [vrf {<vrf-name> | all}] rpf

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic# show ip pim rpf
PIM RPF information for VRF: default Source Group RpfIface RpfAddress RibNextHop Metric Pref 71.0.0.11 233.0.0.1 Vlan100 100.0.0.1 100.0.0.1 0 1 71.0.0.22 235.0.0.1 Vlan100 100.0.0.1 100.0.0.1 0 1

EXAMPLE.summary: show ip pim [vrf {<vrf-name> | all}] rp [Group-addr]

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# show ip pim rp PIM RP information for VRF: default Group RP 225.1.1.1 1.1.1.1 226.1.1.1 10.1.1.1 227.1.1.1 10.1.1.1

EXAMPLE.summary: show ip pim [vrf {<vrf-name> | all}] rp mapping

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# show ip pim rp mapping PIM RP information for VRF: default Group(s):p1, Static RP:1.1.1.1, v2 Group(s):224.0.0.0/4, Static RP:10.1.1.1, v2

EXAMPLE.summary: show ip pim [vrf {<vrf-name> | all}] multicast

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic# show ip pim multicast
PIM multicast information for VRF: default VRF Name :default
Total Dynamic Multicast Routes In VRF :0 Total Dynamic Uninstalled Multicast Routes In VRF :0
Total Dynamic Multicast Routes Across All VRFs :0 Total Dynamic Uninstalled Multicast Routes Across All VRFs :0
Upstream Join Timer in secs :60 JoinPrune Holdtime in secs : PIM ECMP :Disable PIM ECMP Rebalance :Disable
rpfCacheRefreshDelayMsecs :50 rpfCacheRefreshTimer :0 rpfCacheRefreshRequests :0 rpfCacheRefreshEvents :0 rpfCacheRefreshLast :--:--:-- nexthopLookups :0 nexthopLookupsAvoided :0
Multicast Count: --------------- Interface State Address ifIndex Vif PktsIn PktsOut BytesIn BytesOut Ethernet1 up 1.1.1.1 30 1 0 0 0 0

PARAM.name: interfaces
PARAM.help: Clear all PIM interfaces of a particular VRF

PARAM.name: oil
PARAM.help: Clear PIM OIL (Outgoing Interfaces List) of all multicast entries of a particular VRF

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: These commands are useful for debugging. One resets the PIM interfaces. The other rescans the Outgoing Interface Lists (OILs).
DOCGEN.USAGE: * clear ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] interfaces ==> To reset all PIM interfaces of a particular VRF * clear ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] oil ==> To rescan PIM OIL (Outgoing Interfaces List) of all multicast entries of a particular VRF

EXAMPLE.summary: clear ip pim [vrf <vrf-name> ] interfaces

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# clear ip pim interfaces sonic# --------------------------------------- sonic# clear ip pim vrf Vrf2 interfaces sonic#

EXAMPLE.summary: clear ip pim [vrf <vrf-name> ] oil

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# clear ip pim oil sonic# --------------------------------------- sonic# clear ip pim vrf Vrf2 oil sonic#

COMMAND.name: ip pim

PARAM.name: filter
PARAM.help: Pick one command from the following options

PARAM.name: rp-addr
PARAM.help: IPv4 address of the PIM Rendezvous point

PARAM.name: prefix-list
PARAM.help: Corresponding prefix list for this RP

COMMAND.ACTION: sonic_cli_pim patch_pim_global_config vrf:${vrf-name} jpi:${jpi} kat:${kat} pln:${pln} ecmp:${ecmp} rebalance:${rebalance} rp-addr:${rp-addr} rp-pln:${rp-pln} sptlist:${sptlist} infinity:${infinity}

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION:
The following PIM (IPv4) global configurations are executed in configuration-view. All these commands can be executed per VRF. If VRF is not specified, then it will be executed in "default" VRF context. Once PIM global configurations are done on a particular non-default VRF, that VRF cannot be deleted from the system until relevant PIM configurations are cleared.
-------------------- Join Prune Interval: -------------------- Configure the frequency of join/prune messages on the specified interface.
----------------- Keep Alive Timer: ----------------- Period after last (S,G) data packet during which (S,G) Join state will be even in the absence of (S,G) Join messages.
------------------------------ SSM Prefix-list configuration: ------------------------------ Apart from standard PIM-SSM multicast range (232.0.0.0/8), user can qualify other multicast group address as PIM-SSM range using IP-prefix-list. User should create the corresponding IP-prefix-list using existing "ip prefix-list" CLI command and then associate that prefix-list to PIM through this CLI command. This IP-prefix-list cannot be deleted from the system until after removal of any PIM global configuration referring to the prefix list.
----- ECMP: ----- If PIM has the a choice of ECMP nexthops for a particular RPF, PIM will cause S,G flows to be spread out amongst the nexthops. If this command is not specified then the first nexthop found will be used
---------- Static RP: ---------- PIM-ASM builds a shared tree,through which the receivers learn about sources. The Rendezvous point which is the root of this shared tree receives multicast traffic from the source and forwards it to the receiver. This command allows us to configure the RP statically. RP must be configured on all the nodes in the network for PIM-ASM to work.
------------------------------------- spt-threshold infinity configuration: ------------------------------------- By default, router moves to shotrest path tree (SPT) from shared path tree on first multicast data packet receiption. User can change this default behaviour with the help of this command. "ip pim spt-threshold infinity" confiuration prevents router from moving to shortest path tree from shared tree while receiving data from any multicast group.
------------------------------------------------- spt-threshold infinity prefix-list configuration: ------------------------------------------------- When applied this configuration in a multicast router, a router will not move to shortest path tree to receive data from the specific multicast groups.
DOCGEN.USAGE: * ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] join-prune-interval <value : (60-600 seconds)> * ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] keep-alive-timer <value : (31-60000 seconds)> * ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] ssm prefix-list <prefix-list-name> * ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] ecmp [rebalance] * ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] rp-address <rp-addr> prefix-list <prefix-list-name> * ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] spt-threshold infinity prefix-list <prefix-list-name>

EXAMPLE.summary: List of PIM global level commands

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)#
sonic(config)# ip pim vrf VRF name join-prune-interval Configure Join Prune Interval keep-alive-timer Configure Keep Alive timer rp-address Configure PIM RP spt-threshold Shortest path tree switchover ssm Configure SSM ecmp Enable ECMP
sonic(config)# ip pim vrf Vrf1 join-prune-interval Configure Join Prune Interval keep-alive-timer Configure Keep Alive timer rp-address Configure PIM RP spt-threshold Shortest path tree switchover ssm Configure SSM ecmp Enable ECMP
sonic(config)# no ip pim vrf VRF name join-prune-interval Set Join Prune Interval to default keep-alive-timer Set Keep Alive timer to default rp-address Remove PIM RP spt-threshold Shortest path tree switchover ssm Remove SSM configuration ecmp Disable ECMP
sonic(config)# no ip pim vrf Vrf1 join-prune-interval Set Join Prune Interval to default keep-alive-timer Set Keep Alive timer to default rp-address Remove PIM RP spt-threshold Shortest path tree switchover ssm Remove SSM configuration ecmp Disable ECMP

EXAMPLE.summary: ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] join-prune-interval <value : (60-600 seconds)>

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(config)# ip pim join-prune-interval <0..600> Range 60-600 seconds ------------------------------------------------------- sonic(config)# ip pim join-prune-interval 70 sonic(config)# ------------------------------------------------------- sonic(config)# ip pim vrf Vrf1 join-prune-interval 75 sonic(config)#

EXAMPLE.summary: ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] keep-alive-timer <value : (31-60000 seconds)>

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic(config)# ip pim keep-alive-timer <31..60000> Range 31-60000 seconds sonic(config)#
sonic(config)# ip pim keep-alive-timer 35 sonic(config)# ip pim vrf Vrf1 keep-alive-timer 45 sonic(config)#

EXAMPLE.summary: ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] ssm prefix-list <prefix-list-name>

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic(config)# ip pim ssm prefix-list Configure prefix list name
sonic(config)# ip pim ssm prefix-list String Prefix list name
sonic(config)# ip pim ssm prefix-list pim_ssm_pfx_list sonic(config)# ip pim vrf Vrf1 ssm prefix-list pim_ssm_pfx_list sonic(config)#

EXAMPLE.summary: ip pim ecmp

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(config)# ip pim ecmp sonic(config)# ip pim vrf Vrf1 ecmp sonic(config)#

EXAMPLE.summary: ip pim ecmp rebalance

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(config)# ip pim ecmp rebalance sonic(config)# ip pim vrf Vrf1 ecmp rebalance sonic(config)#

EXAMPLE.summary: ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] rp-address <rp-addr>

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic(config)# ip pim rp-address A.B.C.D IPv4 address of the PIM Rendezvous point
sonic(config)# ip pim rp-address pim_rp_address sonic(config)# ip pim vrf Vrf1i rp-address pim_rp_address sonic(config)#

EXAMPLE.summary: ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] rp-address <rp-addr> prefix-list <prefix-list-name>

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic(config)# ip pim rp-address A.B.C.D IPv4 address of the PIM Rendezvous point
sonic(config)# ip pim rp-address pim_rp_address prefix-list Corresponding prefix list for this RP
sonic(config)# ip pim rp-address pim_rp_address prefix-list String Prefix list name
sonic(config)# ip pim rp-address pim_rp_address prefix-list pim_rp_prfx_list sonic(config)# ip pim vrf Vrf1i rp-address pim_rp_address prefix-list pim_rp_prfx_list sonic(config)#

EXAMPLE.summary: ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] spt-threshold infinity prefix-list <prefix-list-name>

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic(config)# ip pim spt-threshold infinity Disables shortest path tree switchover
sonic(config)# ip pim spt-threshold infinity prefix-list Disables shortest path tree switchover for a specific multicast group
sonic(config)# ip pim spt-threshold infinity sonic(config)# ip pim vrf Vrf1 spt-threshold infinity sonic(config)# ip pim spt-threshold infinity prefix-list spt_prefix_list sonic(config)# ip pim vrf Vrf1 spt-threshold infinity prefix-list spt_prefix_list

COMMAND.name: no ip pim

PARAM.name: filter
PARAM.help: Pick one command among following options

PARAM.name: jpi
PARAM.help: Set Join Prune Interval to default

PARAM.name: kat
PARAM.help: Set Keep Alive timer to default

PARAM.name: rp-addr
PARAM.help: IPv4 address of the PIM Rendezvous point

PARAM.name: prefix-list
PARAM.help: Remove Corresponding prefix list for this RP

COMMAND.ACTION: sonic_cli_pim del_pim_global_config ${__full_line} vrf:${vrf-name} jpi:${jpi} kat:${kat} pln:${pln} ecmp:${ecmp} rebalance:${rebalance} rp-addr:${rp-addr} prefix-list:${prefix-list} infinity:${infinity}

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: These commands undo the changes made by the config command.
DOCGEN.USAGE: no ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] join-prune-interval no ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] keep-alive-timer no ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] ssm prefix-list no ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] ecmp [rebalance] no ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] ssm prefix-list no ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] rp-address <rp-addr> prefix-list <prefix-list-name> no ip pim [vrf <vrf-name>] spt-threshold infinity prefix-list <prefix-list-name>

EXAMPLE.summary: no ip pim join-prune-interval

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(config)# no ip pim join-prune-interval sonic(config)# no ip pim vrf Vrf1 join-prune-interval

EXAMPLE.summary: no ip pim keep-alive-timer

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(config)# no ip pim keep-alive-timer sonic(config)# no ip pim vrf Vrf1 keep-alive-timer sonic(config)#

EXAMPLE.summary: no ip pim ssm prefix-list

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(config)# no ip pim ssm prefix-list sonic(config)# no ip pim vrf Vrf1 ssm prefix-list sonic(config)#

EXAMPLE.summary: no ip pim ecmp

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(config)# no ip pim ecmp sonic(config)# no ip pim vrf Vrf1 ecmp sonic(config)#

EXAMPLE.summary: no ip pim ecmp rebalance

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(config)# no ip pim ecmp rebalance sonic(config)# no ip pim vrf Vrf1 ecmp rebalance sonic(config)#

EXAMPLE.summary: no ip pim rp-address

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(config)# no ip pim rp-address pim_rp_address sonic(config)# no ip pim vrf Vrf1i rp-address pim_rp_address

EXAMPLE.summary: no ip pim rp-address prefix-list

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(config)# no ip pim rp-address pim_rp_address prefix-list pim_rp_prfx_list sonic(config)# no ip pim vrf Vrf1i rp-address pim_rp_address prefix-list pim_rp_prfx_list

EXAMPLE.summary: no ip pim spt-threshold infinity

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(config)# no ip pim spt-threshold infinity

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Enable PIM sparse-mode on the given interface

EXAMPLE.summary: Enable PIM sparse-mode on interface Vlan100

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# interface Vlan 100 sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)# ip pim sparse-mode sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)#

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Disable PIM sparse-mode on the given interface

EXAMPLE.summary: Disable PIM sparse-mode on interface Vlan100

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# interface Vlan 100 sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)# no ip pim sparse-mode sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)#

COMMAND.name: ip pim drpriority
COMMAND.ACTION: sonic_cli_pim patch_pim_interface_config_drprio intf:${iface} intf_uri:${iface_uri} drprio:${drprio} intf_range_cmd:arg3

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Set the DR Priority for the PIM interface. This command a allows user to set the priority of a node for becoming the DR on a network to which the interface is attached. A higher value means a higher chances of being elected.

EXAMPLE.summary: Set DR priority value of interface Vlan100 to 10

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# interface Vlan 100 sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)# ip pim drpriority <1..4294967295> Range 1_4294967295
sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)# ip pim drpriority 10 sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)#

COMMAND.name: no ip pim drpriority
COMMAND.help: Set the Designated Router (DR) priority to default

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Set the DR Priority for the PIM interface to the default value.

EXAMPLE.summary: Set the DR priority value of interface Vlan100 to default

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# interface Vlan 100 sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)# no ip pim drpriority sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)#

COMMAND.name: ip pim hello
COMMAND.ACTION: sonic_cli_pim patch_pim_interface_config_hello intf:${iface} intf_uri:${iface_uri} hello:${hello} intf_range_cmd:arg3

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Periodic interval for Hello messages to keep the PIM neighbor session alive. This configuration internally configures the default hold-time (3.5 * Hello-interval); the period to keep the PIM neighbor session alive without receiving hello messages from that particular neighbor.

EXAMPLE.summary: Set the Hello interval of interface Vlan100 to 30

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic# configure terminal sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)# ip pim hello <1..180> Range 1 to 180 in seconds
sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)# ip pim hello 30 sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)#

COMMAND.name: no ip pim hello
COMMAND.help: Set the Hello interval to default

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Sets the Hello interval to the default value.

EXAMPLE.summary: Set the Hello interval of interface Vlan100 to default

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)# no ip pim hello sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)#

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command enables BFD processing for PIM on the given interface.

EXAMPLE.summary: Enable BFD on interface Vlan100

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# interface Vlan 100 sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)# ip pim bfd sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)#

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command disables BFD processing for PIM on the given interface.

EXAMPLE.summary: Disable BFD on interface Vlan100

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# interface Vlan 100 sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)# no ip pim bfd sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)#

COMMAND.name: ip pim bfd profile

PARAM.name: profilename
PARAM.help: Name of BFD profile name (Max: 63 characters)

COMMAND.ACTION: sonic_cli_pim patch_pim_interface_config_bfd_profile intf:${iface} intf_uri:${iface_uri} profile:${profilename} intf_range_cmd:arg3

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command enables BFD profile for PIM on the given interface.

EXAMPLE.summary: Enable BFD profile on interface Vlan100

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# interface Vlan 100 sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)# ip pim bfd profile pim sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)#

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command disables BFD profile for PIM on the given interface.

EXAMPLE.summary: Disable BFD profile on interface Vlan100

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# interface Vlan 100 sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)# no ip pim bfd profile sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)#

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Enable PIM sparse-mode on the given interface

EXAMPLE.summary: Enable PIM sparse-mode on interface Vlan100

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# interface Vlan 100 sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)# ip pim sparse-mode sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)#

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Disable PIM sparse-mode on the given interface

EXAMPLE.summary: Disable PIM sparse-mode on interface Vlan100

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# interface Vlan 100 sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)# no ip pim sparse-mode sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)#

COMMAND.name: ip pim drpriority
COMMAND.ACTION: sonic_cli_pim patch_pim_interface_config_drprio intf:${po_name} intf_uri:${po_name} drprio:${drprio} intf_range_cmd:arg3

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Set the DR Priority for the PIM interface. This command a allows user to set the priority of a node for becoming the DR on a network to which the interface is attached. A higher value means a higher chances of being elected.

EXAMPLE.summary: Set DR priority value of interface Vlan100 to 10

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Set the DR Priority for the PIM interface to the default value.

EXAMPLE.summary: Set the DR priority value of interface Vlan100 to default

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# interface Vlan 100 sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)# no ip pim drpriority sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)#

COMMAND.name: ip pim hello
COMMAND.ACTION: sonic_cli_pim patch_pim_interface_config_hello intf:${vlan_name} intf_uri:${vlan_name} hello:${hello} intf_range_cmd:True

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Periodic interval for Hello messages to keep the PIM neighbor session alive. This configuration internally configures the default hold-time (3.5 * Hello-interval); the period to keep the PIM neighbor session alive without receiving hello messages from that particular neighbor.

EXAMPLE.summary: Set the Hello interval of interface Vlan100 to 30

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE:
sonic# configure terminal sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)# ip pim hello <1..180> Range 1 to 180 in seconds
sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)# ip pim hello 30 sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)#

COMMAND.name: no ip pim hello
COMMAND.help: Set the Hello interval to default

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Sets the Hello interval to the default value.

EXAMPLE.summary: Set the Hello interval of interface Vlan100 to default

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)# no ip pim hello sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)#

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command enables BFD processing for PIM on the given interface.

EXAMPLE.summary: Enable BFD on interface Vlan100

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# interface Vlan 100 sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)# ip pim bfd sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)#

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command disables BFD processing for PIM on the given interface.

EXAMPLE.summary: Disable BFD on interface Vlan100

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# interface Vlan 100 sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)# no ip pim bfd sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)#

COMMAND.name: ip pim bfd profile

PARAM.name: profilename
PARAM.help: Name of BFD profile name (Max: 63 characters)

COMMAND.ACTION: sonic_cli_pim patch_pim_interface_config_bfd_profile intf:${vlan_name} intf_uri:${vlan_name} profile:${profilename} intf_range_cmd:True

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command enables BFD profile for PIM on the given interface.

EXAMPLE.summary: Enable BFD profile on interface Vlan100

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# interface Vlan 100 sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)# ip pim bfd profile pim sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)#

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: This command disables BFD profile for PIM on the given interface.

EXAMPLE.summary: Disable BFD profile on interface Vlan100

DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic# configure terminal sonic(config)# interface Vlan 100 sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)# no ip pim bfd profile sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)#
